results.p: Sep 1, 2024 — The meaning of FERVENT is very hot : glowing. How to use fervent in a sentence. Synonym Discussion of Fervent.
adjective. having or showing great warmth or intensity of spirit, feeling, enthusiasm, etc.; ardent: a fervent admirer; a fervent plea.

results.t: FERVENT | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: showing strong and sincere feelings or beliefs: She was a fervent supporter of art and culture.

results.p: Sep 1, 2024 — Some common synonyms of fervent are ardent, fervid, impassioned, passionate, and perfervid. While all these words mean "showing intense feeling, ...
Use fervent to describe a person or thing that shows very strong feelings or enthusiasm. If you have a fervent desire to become an actress, you'll stop at ...

results.t: FERVENT definition and meaning | Collins English Dictionary
results.p: 2 meanings: 1. intensely passionate; ardent 2. archaic or poetic boiling, burning, or glowing.... Click for more definitions.
fervent · ardent · devout · earnest · ecstatic · emotional · heartfelt · impassioned · intense · passionate · pious · religious · sincere · vehement · zealous.
having or showing very strong feelings. They entered a fervent [=heated] debate over the death penalty. a fervent admirer/supporter/opponent.
If you fervently believe or feel something, then you believe or feel it strongly — with a lot of passion. People feel fervently about a lot of things.
adverb with great intensity of spirit, feeling, enthusiasm, etc.; vehemently: The students are fervently campaigning for reform.
